nlq: List all product lines.
sql: SELECT productLine FROM productlines;

nlq: Show product names, codes, and MSRPs.
sql: SELECT productName, productCode, MSRP FROM products;

nlq: Which customers are in the USA?
sql: SELECT customerName FROM customers WHERE country = 'USA';

nlq: Count employees in the San Francisco office.
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS employee_count FROM employees e JOIN offices o ON e.officeCode = o.officeCode WHERE o.city = 'San Francisco';

nlq: Total amount per order number.
sql: SELECT orderNumber, SUM(quantityOrdered * priceEach) AS total_amount FROM orderdetails GROUP BY orderNumber;

nlq: Customers with credit limits over 100000.
sql: SELECT customerName FROM customers WHERE creditLimit > 100000;

nlq: List all offices with city and country.
sql: SELECT city, country FROM offices;

nlq: Payments made by customer 103.
sql: SELECT checkNumber, paymentDate, amount FROM payments WHERE customerNumber = 103;

nlq: Names and vendors for products in the Classic Cars line.
sql: SELECT productName, productVendor FROM products WHERE productLine = 'Classic Cars';

nlq: How many orders are shipped?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS shipped_orders FROM orders WHERE status = 'Shipped';

nlq: Top 5 orders by total amount.
sql: SELECT o.orderNumber, SUM(od.quantityOrdered * od.priceEach) AS order_total FROM orders o JOIN orderdetails od USING (orderNumber) GROUP BY o.orderNumber ORDER BY order_total DESC LIMIT 5;

nlq: Top 5 customers by total payments.
sql: SELECT c.customerName, SUM(p.amount) AS total_paid FROM customers c JOIN payments p ON c.customerNumber = p.customerNumber GROUP BY c.customerName ORDER BY total_paid DESC LIMIT 5;

nlq: Customers who have never placed an order.
sql: SELECT c.customerName FROM customers c WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM orders o WHERE o.customerNumber = c.customerNumber);

nlq: Orders that were cancelled.
sql: SELECT orderNumber, orderDate FROM orders WHERE status = 'Cancelled';

nlq: Average payment amount per country.
sql: SELECT c.country, AVG(p.amount) AS avg_payment FROM customers c JOIN payments p ON c.customerNumber = p.customerNumber GROUP BY c.country;

nlq: Employees and their managers.
sql: SELECT e.firstName AS employee_first, e.lastName AS employee_last, m.firstName AS manager_first, m.lastName AS manager_last FROM employees e LEFT JOIN employees m ON e.reportsTo = m.employeeNumber;

nlq: Orders with more than 3 line items.
sql: SELECT orderNumber FROM orderdetails GROUP BY orderNumber HAVING COUNT(*) > 3;

nlq: Products low on stock (less than 100).
sql: SELECT productCode, productName, quantityInStock FROM products WHERE quantityInStock < 100;

nlq: Average MSRP by product line.
sql: SELECT productLine, AVG(MSRP) AS avg_msrp FROM products GROUP BY productLine;

nlq: Orders with a shipped date before the required date.
sql: SELECT orderNumber, shippedDate, requiredDate FROM orders WHERE shippedDate < requiredDate;

nlq: Number of customers per country.
sql: SELECT country, COUNT(*) AS customer_count FROM customers GROUP BY country;

nlq: Orders placed in 2004.
sql: SELECT orderNumber, orderDate FROM orders WHERE YEAR(orderDate) = 2004;

nlq: Total quantity ordered per product.
sql: SELECT productCode, SUM(quantityOrdered) AS total_qty FROM orderdetails GROUP BY productCode;

nlq: Products priced above their MSRP (should be none).
sql: SELECT productCode, productName FROM products WHERE buyPrice > MSRP;

nlq: Customers and their sales rep names.
sql: SELECT c.customerName, e.firstName, e.lastName FROM customers c LEFT JOIN employees e ON c.salesRepEmployeeNumber = e.employeeNumber;

nlq: Orders still in process.
sql: SELECT orderNumber, orderDate FROM orders WHERE status = 'In Process';

nlq: Total payments per customer, highest first.
sql: SELECT c.customerName, SUM(p.amount) AS total_paid FROM customers c JOIN payments p ON c.customerNumber = p.customerNumber GROUP BY c.customerName ORDER BY total_paid DESC;

nlq: Customers with no payments.
sql: SELECT c.customerName FROM customers c WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM payments p WHERE p.customerNumber = c.customerNumber);

nlq: Products with more than 500 units in stock.
sql: SELECT productCode, productName, quantityInStock FROM products WHERE quantityInStock > 500;

nlq: Top 3 countries by number of orders.
sql: SELECT c.country, COUNT(*) AS order_count FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customerNumber = o.customerNumber GROUP BY c.country ORDER BY order_count DESC LIMIT 3;

nlq: Average time between order date and required date.
sql: SELECT AVG(DATEDIFF(requiredDate, orderDate)) AS avg_days FROM orders;

nlq: Offices and how many employees work there.
sql: SELECT o.city, o.country, COUNT(e.employeeNumber) AS employee_count FROM offices o LEFT JOIN employees e ON o.officeCode = e.officeCode GROUP BY o.city, o.country;

nlq: Customers in France with their credit limits.
sql: SELECT customerName, creditLimit FROM customers WHERE country = 'France';

nlq: Orders with comments present.
sql: SELECT orderNumber, comments FROM orders WHERE comments IS NOT NULL AND comments <> '';

nlq: Employees who report to no one (top-level).
sql: SELECT firstName, lastName FROM employees WHERE reportsTo IS NULL;

nlq: Average order total for shipped orders.
sql: SELECT AVG(order_total) AS avg_shipped_total FROM (SELECT o.orderNumber, SUM(od.quantityOrdered * od.priceEach) AS order_total FROM orders o JOIN orderdetails od USING (orderNumber) WHERE o.status = 'Shipped' GROUP BY o.orderNumber) t;

nlq: Orders with payment amounts over 50000.
sql: SELECT DISTINCT o.orderNumber FROM orders o JOIN payments p ON o.customerNumber = p.customerNumber WHERE p.amount > 50000;

nlq: Customers and the number of orders they placed.
sql: SELECT c.customerName, COUNT(o.orderNumber) AS order_count FROM customers c LEFT JOIN orders o ON c.customerNumber = o.customerNumber GROUP BY c.customerName;

nlq: Most recent payment per customer.
sql: SELECT p.customerNumber, MAX(p.paymentDate) AS last_payment FROM payments p GROUP BY p.customerNumber;

nlq: Products never ordered.
sql: SELECT p.productCode, p.productName FROM products p WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM orderdetails od WHERE od.productCode = p.productCode);

nlq: Orders that shipped late (after required date).
sql: SELECT orderNumber, requiredDate, shippedDate FROM orders WHERE shippedDate > requiredDate;

nlq: Average payments per month in 2003.
sql: SELECT MONTH(paymentDate) AS month_num, AVG(amount) AS avg_payment FROM payments WHERE YEAR(paymentDate) = 2003 GROUP BY MONTH(paymentDate);

nlq: How many orders from customers in USA have status 'Shipped'?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS order_count FROM orders o JOIN customers c ON o.customerNumber = c.customerNumber WHERE c.country = 'USA' AND o.status = 'Shipped';

nlq: How many orders from customers in USA have status 'Cancelled'?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS order_count FROM orders o JOIN customers c ON o.customerNumber = c.customerNumber WHERE c.country = 'USA' AND o.status = 'Cancelled';

nlq: How many orders from customers in USA have status 'On Hold'?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS order_count FROM orders o JOIN customers c ON o.customerNumber = c.customerNumber WHERE c.country = 'USA' AND o.status = 'On Hold';

nlq: How many orders from customers in USA have status 'Disputed'?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS order_count FROM orders o JOIN customers c ON o.customerNumber = c.customerNumber WHERE c.country = 'USA' AND o.status = 'Disputed';

nlq: How many orders from customers in USA have status 'In Process'?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS order_count FROM orders o JOIN customers c ON o.customerNumber = c.customerNumber WHERE c.country = 'USA' AND o.status = 'In Process';

nlq: How many orders from customers in USA have status 'Resolved'?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS order_count FROM orders o JOIN customers c ON o.customerNumber = c.customerNumber WHERE c.country = 'USA' AND o.status = 'Resolved';

nlq: Which customers in USA have credit limits above 50000?
sql: SELECT customerName FROM customers WHERE country = 'USA' AND creditLimit > 50000;

nlq: Which customers in USA have credit limits above 100000?
sql: SELECT customerName FROM customers WHERE country = 'USA' AND creditLimit > 100000;

nlq: List orders and totals for customers in USA.
sql: SELECT c.customerName, o.orderNumber, SUM(od.quantityOrdered * od.priceEach) AS order_total FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customerNumber = o.customerNumber JOIN orderdetails od ON o.orderNumber = od.orderNumber WHERE c.country = 'USA' GROUP BY c.customerName, o.orderNumber;

nlq: List customers in San Francisco.
sql: SELECT customerName FROM customers WHERE city = 'San Francisco';

nlq: What is the average order total for orders with status Shipped?
sql: SELECT AVG(order_total) AS avg_total FROM (SELECT o.orderNumber, SUM(od.quantityOrdered * od.priceEach) AS order_total FROM orders o JOIN orderdetails od USING (orderNumber) WHERE o.status = 'Shipped' GROUP BY o.orderNumber) t;

nlq: What is the average order total for orders with status Cancelled?
sql: SELECT AVG(order_total) AS avg_total FROM (SELECT o.orderNumber, SUM(od.quantityOrdered * od.priceEach) AS order_total FROM orders o JOIN orderdetails od USING (orderNumber) WHERE o.status = 'Cancelled' GROUP BY o.orderNumber) t;

nlq: What is the average order total for orders with status On Hold?
sql: SELECT AVG(order_total) AS avg_total FROM (SELECT o.orderNumber, SUM(od.quantityOrdered * od.priceEach) AS order_total FROM orders o JOIN orderdetails od USING (orderNumber) WHERE o.status = 'On Hold' GROUP BY o.orderNumber) t;

nlq: What is the average order total for orders with status Disputed?
sql: SELECT AVG(order_total) AS avg_total FROM (SELECT o.orderNumber, SUM(od.quantityOrdered * od.priceEach) AS order_total FROM orders o JOIN orderdetails od USING (orderNumber) WHERE o.status = 'Disputed' GROUP BY o.orderNumber) t;

nlq: What is the average order total for orders with status In Process?
sql: SELECT AVG(order_total) AS avg_total FROM (SELECT o.orderNumber, SUM(od.quantityOrdered * od.priceEach) AS order_total FROM orders o JOIN orderdetails od USING (orderNumber) WHERE o.status = 'In Process' GROUP BY o.orderNumber) t;

nlq: What is the average order total for orders with status Resolved?
sql: SELECT AVG(order_total) AS avg_total FROM (SELECT o.orderNumber, SUM(od.quantityOrdered * od.priceEach) AS order_total FROM orders o JOIN orderdetails od USING (orderNumber) WHERE o.status = 'Resolved' GROUP BY o.orderNumber) t;

nlq: List payments made after 2003 that are over 5000.
sql: SELECT customerNumber, checkNumber, paymentDate, amount FROM payments WHERE YEAR(paymentDate) > 2003 AND amount > 5000;

nlq: What is the average payment amount in 2003?
sql: SELECT AVG(amount) AS avg_payment FROM payments WHERE YEAR(paymentDate) = 2003;

nlq: Find orders placed between 2003 and 2003.
sql: SELECT orderNumber, orderDate FROM orders WHERE orderDate BETWEEN '2003-01-01' AND '2003-12-31';

nlq: Which customers have no payments after 2003?
sql: SELECT c.customerName FROM customers c WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM payments p WHERE p.customerNumber = c.customerNumber AND YEAR(p.paymentDate) > 2003);

nlq: List payments made after 2004 that are over 5000.
sql: SELECT customerNumber, checkNumber, paymentDate, amount FROM payments WHERE YEAR(paymentDate) > 2004 AND amount > 5000;

nlq: What is the average payment amount in 2004?
sql: SELECT AVG(amount) AS avg_payment FROM payments WHERE YEAR(paymentDate) = 2004;

nlq: Find orders placed between 2004 and 2004.
sql: SELECT orderNumber, orderDate FROM orders WHERE orderDate BETWEEN '2004-01-01' AND '2004-12-31';

nlq: Which customers have no payments after 2004?
sql: SELECT c.customerName FROM customers c WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM payments p WHERE p.customerNumber = c.customerNumber AND YEAR(p.paymentDate) > 2004);

nlq: List payments made after 2005 that are over 5000.
sql: SELECT customerNumber, checkNumber, paymentDate, amount FROM payments WHERE YEAR(paymentDate) > 2005 AND amount > 5000;

nlq: What is the average payment amount in 2005?
sql: SELECT AVG(amount) AS avg_payment FROM payments WHERE YEAR(paymentDate) = 2005;

nlq: Find orders placed between 2005 and 2005.
sql: SELECT orderNumber, orderDate FROM orders WHERE orderDate BETWEEN '2005-01-01' AND '2005-12-31';

nlq: Which customers have no payments after 2005?
sql: SELECT c.customerName FROM customers c WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM payments p WHERE p.customerNumber = c.customerNumber AND YEAR(p.paymentDate) > 2005);

nlq: Show the top 5 products by sales amount in the Classic Cars line ordered.
sql: SELECT p.productName, SUM(od.quantityOrdered * od.priceEach) AS total_sales FROM products p JOIN orderdetails od ON p.productCode = od.productCode WHERE p.productLine = 'Classic Cars' GROUP BY p.productName ORDER BY total_sales DESC LIMIT 5;

nlq: Show the top 5 products by sales amount in the Vintage Cars line ordered.
sql: SELECT p.productName, SUM(od.quantityOrdered * od.priceEach) AS total_sales FROM products p JOIN orderdetails od ON p.productCode = od.productCode WHERE p.productLine = 'Vintage Cars' GROUP BY p.productName ORDER BY total_sales DESC LIMIT 5;

nlq: Show the top 5 products by sales amount in the Motorcycles line ordered.
sql: SELECT p.productName, SUM(od.quantityOrdered * od.priceEach) AS total_sales FROM products p JOIN orderdetails od ON p.productCode = od.productCode WHERE p.productLine = 'Motorcycles' GROUP BY p.productName ORDER BY total_sales DESC LIMIT 5;

nlq: Show the top 5 products by sales amount in the Trains line ordered.
sql: SELECT p.productName, SUM(od.quantityOrdered * od.priceEach) AS total_sales FROM products p JOIN orderdetails od ON p.productCode = od.productCode WHERE p.productLine = 'Trains' GROUP BY p.productName ORDER BY total_sales DESC LIMIT 5;

nlq: Show the top 5 products by sales amount in the Planes line ordered.
sql: SELECT p.productName, SUM(od.quantityOrdered * od.priceEach) AS total_sales FROM products p JOIN orderdetails od ON p.productCode = od.productCode WHERE p.productLine = 'Planes' GROUP BY p.productName ORDER BY total_sales DESC LIMIT 5;

nlq: Show the top 5 products by sales amount in the Ships line ordered.

nlq: Show the top 5 products by sales amount in the Trucks and Buses line ordered.
sql: SELECT p.productName, SUM(od.quantityOrdered * od.priceEach) AS total_sales FROM products p JOIN orderdetails od ON p.productCode = od.productCode WHERE p.productLine = 'Trucks and Buses' GROUP BY p.productName ORDER BY total_sales DESC LIMIT 5;

nlq: Show the top 10 products by sales amount ordered.
sql: SELECT p.productName, SUM(od.quantityOrdered * od.priceEach) AS total_sales FROM products p JOIN orderdetails od ON p.productCode = od.productCode GROUP BY p.productName ORDER BY total_sales DESC LIMIT 10;

nlq: List products supplied by Min Lin Diecast.
sql: SELECT productCode, productName FROM products WHERE productVendor = 'Min Lin Diecast';

nlq: List products supplied by Autoart Studio Design.
sql: SELECT productCode, productName FROM products WHERE productVendor = 'Autoart Studio Design';

nlq: List products supplied by Highway 66 Mini Classics.
sql: SELECT productCode, productName FROM products WHERE productVendor = 'Highway 66 Mini Classics';

nlq: List products supplied by Red Start Diecast.
sql: SELECT productCode, productName FROM products WHERE productVendor = 'Red Start Diecast';

nlq: List products supplied by Classic Metal Creations.
sql: SELECT productCode, productName FROM products WHERE productVendor = 'Classic Metal Creations';

nlq: How many employees work in each office?
sql: SELECT o.city, o.country, COUNT(e.employeeNumber) AS employee_count FROM offices o LEFT JOIN employees e ON o.officeCode = e.officeCode GROUP BY o.city, o.country;

nlq: Show 5 orders with the highest number of line items.
sql: SELECT orderNumber, COUNT(*) AS line_items FROM orderdetails GROUP BY orderNumber ORDER BY line_items DESC, orderNumber ASC LIMIT 5;

nlq: Show 10 orders with the highest number of line items.
sql: SELECT orderNumber, COUNT(*) AS line_items FROM orderdetails GROUP BY orderNumber ORDER BY line_items DESC, orderNumber ASC LIMIT 10;

nlq: Find orders where the customer has never made a payment.
sql: SELECT DISTINCT o.orderNumber FROM orders o WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM payments p WHERE p.customerNumber = o.customerNumber);

nlq: Count Shipped orders for USA with totals over 50000.
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS order_count FROM (SELECT o.orderNumber, SUM(od.quantityOrdered * od.priceEach) AS total_amount FROM orders o JOIN customers c ON o.customerNumber = c.customerNumber JOIN orderdetails od ON o.orderNumber = od.orderNumber WHERE c.country = 'USA' AND o.status = 'Shipped' GROUP BY o.orderNumber HAVING total_amount > 50000) t;
